sessionHeatmap.title: Reading Session Activity
sessionHeatmap.tooltip: A daily heatmap of your reading sessions for the selected year. Darker cells mean more sessions that day. Streak stats track consecutive reading days across all time. Milestones unlock as you hit streak or total-day thresholds.
sessionHeatmap.description: Daily overview of your reading sessions across the year

sessionTimeline.title: Reading Session Timeline
sessionTimeline.tooltip: Shows your reading sessions laid out across each day of the week. Each block represents a session, sized by duration. Hover to see book title, pages read, and time spent. Use the week navigator to browse your reading history week by week.
sessionTimeline.description: Weekly overview of your reading sessions and patterns

genreStats.title: Reading by Genre
genreStats.tooltip: Ranks your top genres by total reading time. Each bar shows how many hours you've spent reading books in that genre, so you can see where most of your reading time actually goes.
genreStats.description: Top genres by total reading time

favoriteDays.title: Favorite Reading Days
favoriteDays.tooltip: Bars show how many reading sessions and total reading time you logged on each day of the week. Filter by year and month to spot seasonal patterns. Helps you find your most productive reading days.
favoriteDays.description: Reading sessions and duration by day of the week

peakHours.title: Peak Reading Hours
peakHours.tooltip: Shows the number of reading sessions and total reading time for each hour of the day (midnight to 11pm). Filter by year and month to see how your habits shift over time. The peak hour highlights when you read the most.
peakHours.description: Reading activity by hour of the day

personalRating.title: Personal Rating Distribution
personalRating.tooltip: Shows how many books you've given each rating from 1 to 10. Helps you see whether you tend to rate generously, harshly, or cluster around a particular score. Only books with a personal rating are included.

readStatus.title: Reading Status Distribution
readStatus.tooltip: Breaks down your entire library by reading status: read, reading, partially read, paused, abandoned, won't read, and unread. Gives you a quick snapshot of how much of your collection you've worked through.

readingDna.title: Reading DNA Profile
readingDna.tooltip: A radar chart profiling your reading personality across 8 dimensions. Scores are computed from your library's genres, ratings, page counts, publication dates, and reading progress. Each trait uses non-overlapping criteria for accurate results.
readingDna.description: Your unique reading personality across 8 dimensions

adventurous.low: You tend to stick to familiar genres and formats
adventurous.mid: You enjoy a healthy mix of genres and styles
adventurous.high: You explore a wide variety of genres, languages, and formats

perfectionist.low: You keep many books in progress or unfinished
perfectionist.mid: You finish most books and favor quality reads
perfectionist.high: You almost always finish what you start and seek top-rated books

intellectual.low: Your reading leans toward lighter subjects
intellectual.mid: You balance entertainment with educational reading
intellectual.high: You gravitate heavily toward non-fiction and scholarly material

emotional.low: You tend toward plot-driven or factual reading
emotional.mid: You enjoy a mix of emotional and analytical reads
emotional.high: You connect deeply with memoirs, poetry, and emotionally rich stories

patient.mid: You occasionally tackle longer works and series
patient.high: You regularly take on epic novels and multi-book series

social.low: You prefer niche or lesser-known titles
social.mid: You read a mix of popular and niche titles
social.high: Your library is packed with bestsellers and widely-discussed books

nostalgic.mid: You appreciate a mix of classic and modern works
nostalgic.high: You have a deep love for classic literature and older works

ambitious.low: You read at a casual pace with shorter books
ambitious.mid: You maintain a solid reading volume with some challenging picks
ambitious.high: You push yourself with large volumes of challenging, lengthy books

readingHabits.title: Reading Habits Analysis
readingHabits.tooltip: A radar chart analyzing your reading behavior across 8 dimensions. Consistency measures regularity of completions over time. Completionism tracks finish vs. abandonment rate. Methodology checks if you read series in order. Scores are derived from your reading activity, dates, and progress data.
readingHabits.description: Your behavioral reading patterns across 8 dimensions

consistency.low: Your reading is sporadic with long gaps between books
consistency.mid: You read at a fairly regular pace throughout the year
consistency.high: You maintain a very steady, disciplined reading rhythm

multitasking.low: You prefer focusing on one book at a time
multitasking.mid: You occasionally juggle a couple of books at once
multitasking.high: You regularly read multiple books simultaneously

completionism.low: You often set books aside before finishing them
completionism.mid: You finish most books you start, with a few exceptions
completionism.high: You almost never abandon a book once you start it

exploration.low: You tend to revisit favorite authors and familiar territory
exploration.mid: You balance familiar authors with occasional new discoveries
exploration.high: You actively seek out new authors, eras, and languages

organization.low: Your library could use more rating and status tracking
organization.mid: You keep your library reasonably well curated
organization.high: You diligently rate, categorize, and track every book

intensity.low: You lean toward shorter, lighter reads
intensity.mid: You read a mix of short and longer books
intensity.high: You consistently tackle lengthy, immersive books

methodology.low: You pick books spontaneously without a system
methodology.mid: You show some methodical patterns in your reading choices
methodology.high: You systematically work through series, authors, and genres

momentum.low: Your reading activity has been quiet recently
momentum.mid: You have a steady reading pace going
momentum.high: You are on a strong active reading streak right now

readingHeatmap.title: Reading Activity Heatmap
readingHeatmap.tooltip: A 10-year grid showing how many books were added to your library each month. Darker cells mean more books. Helps you visualize long-term acquisition trends and seasonal reading bursts.
readingHeatmap.description: Monthly reading activity over the past 10 years

readingProgress.title: Reading Progress Distribution
readingProgress.tooltip: Shows how many books fall into each progress bracket: not started (0%), just started (1-25%), halfway (26-50%), mostly done (51-75%), nearly finished (76-99%), and completed (100%). Progress is based on the furthest point reached across all reading sessions.

ratingTaste.title: Rating Taste Comparison
ratingTaste.tooltip: Each dot is a book plotted by its external rating (X-axis, e.g. Goodreads/Amazon) versus your personal rating (Y-axis). Books on the diagonal mean you agree with the crowd. Above the line means you rated higher; below means you rated lower. Quadrants show your taste patterns.
ratingTaste.description: Compare your personal ratings against external ratings (Goodreads, Amazon, etc.)
ratingTaste.quadrantDescHiddenGems: Books you rate higher than the public
ratingTaste.quadrantDescPopularFavorites: Books you and the public both love
ratingTaste.quadrantDescAgreedMisses: Books neither you nor public enjoyed

seriesProgress.title: Series Progress Tracker
seriesProgress.tooltip: Shows each book series in your library as a stacked bar: read, reading, and unread volumes. Series are sorted by completion percentage. Use this to spot which series you've fallen behind on or are close to finishing.
seriesProgress.description: Track your reading progress across book series
seriesProgress.noData: No series found in your library.
seriesProgress.noDataHint: Books need series metadata to appear here.

pageTurner.title: Page Turner Score
pageTurner.tooltip: Each book gets a 'grip score' (0-100) based on how your reading behavior changed over time. It measures whether your sessions got longer, whether gaps between sessions shrank, and whether you had a burst of reading near the end. Higher scores mean the book pulled you in more as you read.
pageTurner.description: How gripping each book was based on your reading patterns

completionRace.title: Reading Completion Race
completionRace.tooltip: Each line represents a completed book's reading journey. The X-axis shows days since you started that book, and the Y-axis shows your progress from 0% to 100%. Steeper lines mean faster reads. Only books marked as 'Read' with tracked sessions are included.
completionRace.description: Compare how quickly you finished different books
completionRace.noData: No completed books with reading sessions found for {{ year }}.
completionRace.noDataHint: Complete some books with tracked reading sessions to see your completion races.

readingSurvival.title: Reading Survival Curve
readingSurvival.tooltip: Inspired by survival analysis: starting from all books you've begun reading, this curve shows what fraction made it to each progress milestone. A steep drop at a threshold reveals where you tend to abandon books. The 'danger zone' highlights the steepest single drop-off point.
readingSurvival.description: Of books started, what percentage reached each progress threshold
readingSurvival.tooltipSurvival: {{ value }}% of books reached this point
readingSurvival.noData: No books with reading progress found.
readingSurvival.noDataHint: Start reading some books to see your survival curve.

readingClock.title: Reading Clock
readingClock.tooltip: Each segment of the clock represents one hour of the day (12am-11pm). The size of each segment shows how many total minutes you've spent reading during that hour across all time. Warm colors indicate your busiest hours. You're classified as a Night Owl (most reading 8pm-2am), Early Bird (5am-11am), or Balanced.
readingClock.description: When do you read throughout the day
readingClock.noDataHint: Track your reading sessions to see your reading clock.

bookLength.title: Book Length Sweet Spot
bookLength.tooltip: Each dot is a book you've rated, plotted by its page count (X-axis) and your personal rating (Y-axis). Colors indicate read status: green = read, blue = reading, red = abandoned. The trend line shows whether you tend to rate longer or shorter books higher. The 'sweet spot' is the page-count range where your average rating is highest.
bookLength.description: How book length relates to your personal ratings
